headline: Honey Whole Wheat Bread
description: The bread machine makes this honey wheat bread recipe easy yet delicious and soft. This classic flavor combination will be a household favorite.
name: Honey Whole Wheat Bread
recipeIngredient: 1.125 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

recipeInstructions.text: Place water, honey, oil, whole wheat flour, bread flour, salt, then yeast into a bread machine in the order listed, or follow the order recommended by the manufacturer if different.
Run Whole Wheat cycle, light color setting.
Remove loaf from the machine after the cycle is done, about 3 hours.

review.reviewBody: Loved the bread. Easy to make. Family thought it was delicious.
Perfect. So delicious. First time with new bread machine. I put warm water in pan to warm it and then dried it before I put I ingredients. My kitchen was cold. I thought it might make a difference.

The recipe was pretty good, I cooked this meal two times. The first time I followed the expect recipe and it turned out pretty good, second time was even better. I accidentally cooked it longer than it said because I forgot the bread was in the oven, but when I took it out it was soooo good. 8.5/10
Great recipe, I add chia, ground flax, sunflower seeds, and an egg to make heartier version. Or cinnamon and raisins. Always turns out good. Thanks
I followed directions as stated. The bread sunk in the middle and the crust is very hard. I haven’t tasted it yet. What did I do wrong? Is it my machine? Phyllis from Oshkosh

I had to give it a four star review because I went off the reviews of other. I did the 1/4 c honey, 2 c whole wheat and 1 c bread flour. With those it was great. I will go back and try the original just because I feel I owe it to the person who gave us this recipe. Thanks. Update : I made this recipe as written and it was fantastic. Came out perfect. It was great for my peanut butter and honey sandwich. Will be making again.
I made straight from recipe, came out very gummy. Will try again and read reviews. If I decide to bake in oven, what size pan should I use?
Followed the other recipes, substituted butter for oil, 2 cups wheat & 1 cup bread. 1/4 cup honey…still a little dry so may use milk instead of water next time. Overall great for my 2nd loaf!

Made loaf following other reviewer’s tweaks using 2 cups wheat flour, 1 cup white flour, 1/4 cup honey 1 tsp salt and 2 tbs butter. I also added 1 tbs vital wheat gluten It was easy and very tasty. I will definitely make it again
Probably should have added a small amount of gluten to it. Could have used a little more fluff to it.
I increased the honey to 1/4 cup. Love the texture and flavor of this bread.
Good recipe. I followed suggestions of others and used 1c whole wheat, 1 cup bread flour, 3/4 tsp salt AND added 4tsp gluten to make softer sandwich bread.
OMG! Best texture and taste ever! I make this every week now.

Following the instructions in the top comments this came out perfect in the bread machine:
- 1/4 cup honey
- 2 cups whole wheat flour
- 1 cup bread flour
- 2T melted butter instead of oil
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 1/2 tsp active dry yeast
- 1 1/8 C warm water

Will make again.
This bread came out perfect! The taste, texture, and appearance all make it a new favorite for us. Yum!
Beside the amount of calories per slice , it's well worth the eat. Excellent! Good texture and flavor.

I made this and followed several of the other reviews. I also live about 4700 feet so I used 1 cup +1TBS of warm water. I then increased the honey to a 1/4 cup 1tsp yeast 2 cups whole wheat flour 1 cup white all purpose flour and one tsp salt subtitled butter for the oil. Used my stand mixer allowed to raise until just over the top of loaf pan and then pre heated my air fryer to 375 deg. Placed the loaf pan in the air fryer and cooked at 375 for 33 minutes used an instant read thermometer and checked for internal temperature of 200 deg. The bread came out perfectly great.

I followed what all the other reviewers said and used 2 c wheat, 1 c white, 4T honey, 2T butter and 1 t salt. I weighed my flour instead of measuring. It completely touched the lid of the machine and deflated, ruining the look of the loaf. Tasted great but wow. This is way too much. I made a second batch on dough-only mode and then formed it into 8 sandwich size rolls. Let rise, covered for 30 minutes then bake for 15 minutes on 350. (the second batch had maple syrup rather than honey... not as good!) Next time I use the machine for this recipe, I'm going to adjust it down to 8 servings instead of 10. If that doesn't work, I'll just use the loaf pan and the oven like others have suggested. I rated it four stars because it really does taste great but it is just too much for the machine.

Like others I used 1C flour, 2C whole wheat flour, and 3Tbsp molasses in place of honey. The loaf is very tasty. I think I will get it ready in the machine, then bake in the oven next time. A good recipe. Thanks.
1/4 cup honey, 2 T melted butter instead of oil, 1 tsp salt
sweet n delicious!

Step 1
Place the water, sugar and yeast in the pan of the bread machine. Let the yeast dissolve and foam for 10 minutes. Add the oil, flour and salt to the yeast. 

Select Basic or Bread setting, and press Start.

This has become my go-to recipe because it is repeatable and very good. The only modification I make is that after weighing the all-purpose white flour, I remove 4 teaspoons of it and replace with about 4 teaspoons of vital wheat gluten. I also weigh my flours (195g whole wheat, 188g of all purpose) instead of measuring by cups which can be inaccurate. I bake in conventional oven after processing the dough on the “Dough” cycle in a bread machine. If I am able to catch the dough and remove it from the machine right after the final “punch down” step (usually about 20 minutes or so before end of cycle) I pull it out and transfer to the baking pan (after shaping and lightly flouring) so that I don’t “waste” too much of its rising capacity by handling repeatedly.

Turned out great! Like several others, I made a couple mods. I upped the honey to 1/4 cup and the salt to 1 tsp. I also added 1 tsp of potato flour, which I think improves the texture of most sandwich breads. The resulting bread is delicious and soft. Will make again.
I used 1/4 cup honey, 1 tsp. salt, 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1 cup bread flour, and 2 tbsp. melted butter as recommended by Beverly Langston. Turned out great!
Simple recipe, but I felt it cont'd out less fluffy and flavorful than many other breads.

My family loved this bread. It was light and airy. However, I did take other reviewers advice and used 2 cups whole wheat flour & 1 cup bread flour, 1 tsp salt, 1/4 cup honey, and 2 tbsp melted butter instead of oil.

This was my first time ever making bread or using a bread machine. I took the recommendations and made the changes on wheat flour, bread flour and honey. I used 2 c. wheat flour, 1 c. bread flour and 1/4 c. honey. It came out delicious! On my bread machine I selected basic, light setting and 1.5 loaf size. Crust was slightly crunchy and delicious. Kiddos loved it!

This was really really good. The only change I made was to increase the amount of honey to 1/4 cup just to ensure that nice honey flavor. It came out soft, nutty, a little sweet. My kids also loved it. The perfect PB&J bread!

The was too much water in this recipe. I followed some suggestions to increase the honey, use butter instead of oil and increase the salt. The mix never came together into a dough and results in a dense under cooked block from my bread machine.

A loaf for those that don't particularly like or eat wheat breads often. Loaf is made with half wheat flour and bread flour so taste is very mild with the sweetness of honey coming through. Very pleased with this one.
I have been making this bread in my bread machine every week for months. It creates a great toastable slice of bread. I use the hard crust option on my bread machine
I used the 1.5 pounds loaf settings

I made it according to the recipe and threw it out! I added more water , honey, salt , 1/2 oil 1/2 butter , 2 c bread machine flour to I cup whole wheat. I also added currants. The bread came out fantastic
I followed the recipe exactly as written because I didn’t read the reviews first, and it was so bland. I wouldn’t make this recipe again without changing the amounts.

I make this in a bread machine. I scale down to 12 servings which ends up being a loaf. I go ahead and use a whole packet rise instant yeast with warm water and brown sugar or honey or both because we like our bread slightly sweeter. I also put a Heaping Tbs of powdered buttermilk blend and increase butter to 2 Tbs. throw it all in the bread machine on 1 lb loaf med crust and presto!
No changes to recipe. Top collapsed in my Zojirushi but the bread was still tasty.
Delish. Didn't have honey so used corn syrup, but otherwise followed recipe and it came out great.
I followed the recipe exactly and the bread was excellent. I will definitely make it again.

I LOVE this bread!
Like others I changed things a bit but only because I know my family likes slightly sweeter bread. So: I added 1/4 c raw honey, 1 tsp salt, 1/4 c margarine (I don't have access to butter). Oh, and in my warm and humid country, I only added 1 tsp active dry yeast on top of the 2c wheat flour, 1c bread flour and 1 tbsp of wheat gluten. The machine setting was wheat, and medium crust.
So, ok, I changed it a lot! But, seriously, this recipe was the basis so credit where credit is due, right?
The bread was DIVINE. Soft and fluffy, lots of wheat nuttiness, the crust was perfect (not too thick or tough).
My go-to recipe from now on!
it was a flop I don't know what I did wrong
Good loaf, by hand. I did up the salt to a teaspoon and added a little more honey, as did many of the other reviewers. . Nice, crumb, crust and flavor.
Easy and excellent!
This was great, added 2 TBSP vital wheat gluten because I love really raised bread.

My 5 year old son is somewhat of bread snob and is picky about his bread with normally the fancier it is the better he will eat it. I've been searching and trying wheat bread recipes with mediocre results until I found this recipe. I normally make 2 loaves a week and as the recipe is I give it 5 stars. His preference is a little sweeter tasting so I did go on the advice of others on here and add 1/4 cup honey instead of 3 tbsp honey, added 1 tsp salt instead 1/3 tsp and added 2 cups wheat flour and 1 cup bread flour instead 1 1/2 cup wheat and 1 1/2 cup bread flour. He says it's perfect with the extra honey and loves it! Thanks for sharing it
I used 1/2 cup potato flakes and butter instead of oil.
Pleased with this bread I didn’t change anything except I took it out of the machine and baked in the oven 375 degrees for 35 minutes

This was a nice change from the recipes that were included with the bread machine. The bread is soft and porous, and this is the first recipe that my kids have asked me to make again (we just got the bread machine, and are trying different kinds). The recipe doesn't indicate the loaf size, but it worked as a 2.5 pound loaf in my machine.
Easy very good. Crust is perfect.
Very good. I used maple syrup instead of honey but apart from that, I followed the recipe exactly. I am making this loaf again today! Delicious!
followed recipe exactly. set machine for a 1.5 lb. perfect.
Dear wife and I made this today and dang this is delicious. Followed it as per instructions and next time we'll do the revision others have talked about doing.
Very good taste, light and airy!

I was about to toss my bread machine out because I've NEVER had anything decent come out of it...until today when I tried this recipe. PERFECTION!!!!! THANK YOU for posting it for the rest of us to try!

I've made bread for years and this recipe is the BEST wheat bread! It is soo soft and turned out beautiful. I will be only making this recipe from now on. I didn't use a bread machine at all. did it all myself. the only thing I changed was, I added more honey. thank you.
It came out fine but it is a little bland.
I was really disappointed with this recipe. I followed other reviewers suggestions and added a little more honey and salt than it called for, but the end result was still tasteless.

This bread came out PERFECT! I followed the one review of adding 1/4 cup honey. I also only used wheat flour as I did not have any bread flour on me, and it was still amazing! My kids love it and I've made it several times already.
My wife loves this bread! She prefers it to the store-bought bread. The one thing I changed was that I use 3 tablespoons of oil.

I made this bread according to recipe but was disappointed in the flavor. The crust was crispy and the texture was good. But the flavor was very bland. Even butter didn't help. I think the recipe needed a little more salt. I will probably add some seasonings and make croutons with the rest of the bread loaf. 

Sorry.....I wanted to like this bread.
I made this as is and it was really good! It will definitely be a bread I make again!
No changes . It's a great low sodium recipe for whole wheat

I have been trying several wheat bread recipes from Allrecipes. This is my favorite so far. Making a second loaf this morning. I love wheat bread. All wheat is too dry, but half white, half wheat is tender. I used to make home made bread all the time when kids were little. This compares to that consistency very well. Just husband and I now. One loaf lasting 3-5 days. Perfect!
I made it with the additions classylady suggested & it turned out great!
My wife is the whole wheat person and she like it, however she didn't think it should have honey and then I told her it was honey whole wheat bread
This is very crumbly.

I followed the other reviewers advice with the ingredient measurement changes and it came out great. I used a breadmaker. How do I make this into a 2 lb loaf for the breadmaker? It is currently a 1 lb loaf.

I did not like this recipe. The end result came out looking good, smelling nice, but the taste was just NOT there. It was slightly gummy (even though baked through). I will not be using this particular recipe again. It may be great for others, but for me, I'd have to say, nay.
Easy. Tastes good. Calories.

I took the guidance of previous reviewers: used 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1 cup bread flour, substituted maple syrup for honey and increased it to 1/4 cup and finally increased the salt to 1 tsp. I got a lovely result!
I made this recipe for the first time and it sunk in the middle and didn't rise. I don't know what I did wrong. I measured the ingredients perfectly.
Made exact recipe. Came out very nice, altho I would add more salt as suggested. Nice for sandwiches. Thinking of adding some herbs next time.
I added a 1/3 cup of honey. I like is sweet. YUM!!!
Really great recipe! I had the bread maker do all the work but baked it in the oven. It tasted great even two days later.
Used 3 cups whole wheat Robin Hood best for bread flour, turned out great!

Excellent easy hearty bread recipe. Very tasty. Will add more honey next time. Hubby loved it too. I added 1/4 cup honey but a little more would be good. Toasted brought out the flavor. I should have used the whole grain cycle. Store bread getting too pricey, will use this recipe a lot!

I tried with 1/4 cup honey and 3/4 tsp salt according to other reviewers. I also added some sunflower kernels. Even though my dough was really wet, and the bread is dented, it turns out to be delicious, soft and fluffy. But I still keep wondering if anyone had a really wet dough like mine. Anyway, I am going to try it again and give as a gift to one of my friends.
My family doesn't care for too much wheat taste, so I used 2 cups flour ,1 cup wheat. It was gone in 1 hour.
I've made this recipe a dozen times and it turns out great each time. I'm sure you could tweak the ingredients to suit your tastes, but as is this recipe is a winner.
Quite good, would definitely recommend. I had also tried it with just all-purpose flour and had enjoyed the flavor more.
Couldn't taste the honey.

Everyone loves it. I used butter instead of oil, increased the salt to 3/4 tsp, and used 1/4 cup of honey. I selected the dough setting on the bread machine, and baked the bread in the oven on convection at 365 degrees in a Pyrex loaf pan for 30 minutes.

This recipe is my very favorite one. I have made about 42 loaves so far over the last two years for just my husband and myself! I use 2 cups whole wheat and 1 cup bread flour, 1/4 cup honey (no molasses), 1 tsp salt and 2 Tbsp sunflower oil for the shortening. Thank you to Kathy for this top notch recipe!!

I added 1-1/2 cups warm water; 2 cups whole wheat flour and didn't have any bread flour so used 1 cup regular white flour. The rest of the ingredients I used as in the recipe. It came out very moist, not overly sweet and a very nice texture for cutting. I will definitely make this recipe again.
Very good- I've done a lot of baking with my machine and this loaf came out the easiest to cut into nice slices like store bought. Appreciate the no refined sugars and preservatives!
Best bread I have made in my bread machine! I used 2 cups of whole wheat and 1 cup of bread flour to make it a little healthier, still came out light and fluffy.

I did as the reviews said and used 2 cups wheat flour, 1 cup bread flour, 1 tsp salt and 2 T butter. Recipe is for 1 1/2 lb loaf. This bread was delicious.... one of the best I have made. It is very soft and not overly sweet. My kids and husband also loved it. Thank you for an easy and tasty recipe!
Awesome bread machine recipes. I followed other's suggestions and changed amounts of flour, salt and honey.

My family loves this bread! My kids have never liked store bought wheat bread due to dryness. But they love the soft, moist texture and sweetness of this wheat bread. I took the advice of others to suit our tastes. (2 c whole wheat, 1/4 c honey OR molasses).

I just made this recipe twice and this is the best wholewheat recipe I have made in my bread machine so far. I adjusted the honey to 1/4 cup and added 2 Tbs. of Vital Wheat Gluten and used the White Bread cycle. Very tasty and good color. I also tried the recipe using with 2 cups of Whole Wheat and 1 cup of White Bread flour. Also very tasty however did not rise as well. In addition I have left the salt out of the recipe as I have to lower my sodium intake and it does not seem to affect the taste, I could not taste a difference

One of the very best if not the best bread recipe. I also live at high altitude and used a slightly modified recipe as submitted by EJonespr - but the bread is top notch and will make it regularly. The texture is perfect - it is hard to get a good bread at over 6,000 feet high altitude. Thank you so much.

This is a delicious recipe. I love the slightly chewy texture of the bread; I rarely get that from bread maker recipes. I did 1 cup whole wheat and 1/2 cup white and it turned out perfectly. A little extra honey adds a touch of sweetness.

Mine keeps sinking in the middle. It rises great but when it bakes it falls every time. I have tried the whole wheat setting and basic setting with the same result. I have white bread down to a science but the darn wheat is putting up a fight. Yes I measure ingreadents carefully.
This bread is amazing! Sliced with an electric knife and it's perfect for sandwiches.
This made a beautiful loaf of bread, and it tasted great.

Thank you all for your tweaks. This is the best wheat bread I have ever made. I put in 1/4 C of honey, 1 tsp. Salt, 2 C whole wheat flour, 1 C of all purpose flour, and 2 tbsp. Of butter instead of what was listed on the recipe. I baked it in a bread machine using the basic setting, light crust and 1.5 lb. loaf. Even my husband ate it, and he is not a fan of wheat bread!

Loved this bread recipe! Like others, I used 1/4 cup of molasses instead of 3 Tbsp of honey, and 1 tsp of salt. Also used 3 cups of whole wheat bread machine flour. The bread came out a beautiful shade of brown from the molasses, and was just perfect moistness and flavour. Next loaf I'll try 1/4 cup of honey instead and see how it comes out.
Very moist! I followed other reviewers and increased the honey to 1/4 c and salt to 1 tsp. I left the flour as directed.

Yes! I love this recipe! I wanted to use my bread machine without having to take the dough out, etc. I made this bread using this exact recipe, thinking I could tinker with it later IF it came out at all. YAY! It came out with just a slight drop on one side - This bread is delicious! I didn't change this recipe at all. My daughter loved it too, and she would not hesitate to let me know if she didn't like it.
